main event: Several witnesses observed a string of lights flying over Craig, Colorado on the evening of 26 September 1956.
interesting points: Witnesses described the object as a string of approximately ten lights preceded by three or four smaller lights,The object was first noticed by a witness due to a bright flash in the sky,The estimated speed of the object was between 85 to 100 MPH,No sound was heard during the observation, which suggests the object was not a typical aircraft,Four confirmed witnesses corroborated the sighting, reporting the same time and course of the object.
witness description: One witness was a 28-year-old night baker and Navy veteran; others were family members.
